item.title: The holy city of Varanasi, India (© Jesse Rockwell/Shutterstock)
item.description: 图文来源自：bing. copyright: © Jesse Rockwell/Shutterstock Known for its sacred ghats and bustling alleys, Varanasi is a city on the banks of the Ganges in the northern part of India. Located about 120 kilometres downstream from Prayagraj, at the confluence of the Ganges and Yamuna rivers, it is a major pilgrimage site for Hindu spirituality and tradition. The mighty Ganges is said to have originated in Lord Shiva’s hair and grown into the revered river that flows through Varanasi today.
